# 500+ Python Exercises - Part 2

## Section 7: Lists (50 exercises)

### Easy (1-18)

1. Create empty list and print it
2. Create list with 5 integers
3. Create list with mixed data types
4. Access first element of list
5. Access last element of list
6. Access element at index 3
7. Find length of list
8. Append element to end of list
9. Insert element at specific position
10. Remove element by value
11. Remove element by index
12. Pop last element from list
13. Find index of element
14. Count occurrence of element
15. Sort list in ascending order
16. Sort list in descending order
17. Reverse a list
18. Copy a list

### Medium (19-35)

19. Find sum of all elements
20. Find maximum element
21. Find minimum element
22. Find average of elements
23. Count even numbers in list
24. Count odd numbers in list
25. Find all prime numbers in list
26. Remove duplicates from list
27. Merge two lists
28. Find common elements in two lists
29. Find difference of two lists
30. Find intersection of two lists
31. Find union of two lists
32. Rotate list by n positions
33. Find second largest element
34. Find second smallest element
35. Move zeros to end of list

### Hard (36-50)

36. Find majority element (> n/2 occurrences)
37. Find missing number in sequence 1-n
38. Find duplicate in array
39. Find pair with given sum
40. Find triplet with given sum
41. Find maximum subarray sum (Kadane's)
42. Find product of array except self
43. Find leaders in array
44. Find trapping rainwater
45. Find maximum profit from stock prices
46. Implement two stacks in one list
47. Find equilibrium index
48. Find pivot index
49. Sort array of 0s, 1s, 2s (Dutch flag)
50. Find kth largest element

---

## Section 8: Tuples & Sets (40 exercises)

### Tuples (1-20)

1. Create empty tuple
2. Create tuple with 5 elements
3. Create tuple with single element
4. Access tuple element by index
5. Find length of tuple
6. Concatenate two tuples
7. Repeat tuple n times
8. Find index of element in tuple
9. Count occurrence of element
10. Find maximum in tuple
11. Find minimum in tuple
12. Sum all elements in tuple
13. Convert list to tuple
14. Convert tuple to list
15. Unpack tuple into variables
16. Create nested tuple
17. Access nested tuple elements
18. Find hash of tuple
19. Check if element exists in tuple
20. Slice a tuple

### Sets (21-40)

21. Create empty set
22. Create set with elements
23. Add element to set
24. Remove element from set
25. Discard element from set
26. Pop element from set
27. Clear all elements from set
28. Find length of set
29. Check if element exists in set
30. Find union of two sets
31. Find intersection of two sets
32. Find difference of two sets
33. Find symmetric difference
34. Check if set is subset
35. Check if set is superset
36. Check if sets are disjoint
37. Add multiple elements to set
38. Update set with another set
39. Find set comprehension
40. Remove duplicates from list using set

---

## Section 9: Dictionaries (50 exercises)

### Easy (1-18)

1. Create empty dictionary
2. Create dictionary with key-value pairs
3. Access value by key
4. Add new key-value pair
5. Update value of existing key
6. Remove key-value pair
7. Find length of dictionary
8. Check if key exists
9. Get all keys
10. Get all values
11. Get all key-value pairs
12. Get value with default
13. Copy dictionary
14. Clear dictionary
15. Create dictionary from keys
16. Create dictionary from values
17. Merge two dictionaries
18. Find key with maximum value

### Medium (19-35)

19. Find key with minimum value
20. Sort dictionary by keys
21. Sort dictionary by values
22. Count frequency of elements using dict
23. Invert dictionary (keys become values)
24. Find common keys in two dicts
25. Find difference of keys
26. Group elements by key
27. Filter dictionary by value
28. Map dictionary values
29. Create nested dictionary
30. Access nested dictionary
31. Flatten nested dictionary
32. Convert two lists to dictionary
33. Convert dictionary to list of tuples
34. Find top 3 values
35. Find top 3 keys

### Hard (36-50)

36. Implement LRU cache using dict
37. Find anagrams grouping
38. Find word frequency in text
39. Implement phone book
40. Implement inventory system
41. Find pairs with given sum
42. Find longest chain of pairs
43. Implement trie using nested dicts
44. Find shortest path in graph
45. Count connected components
46. Implement hash map
47. Find majority element
48. Find k most frequent elements
49. Find minimum window substring
50. Implement autocomplete system

## Section 10: File Handling (40 exercises)

### Easy (1-15)

1. Create new text file
2. Write text to file
3. Read entire file content
4. Read file line by line
5. Read first n lines
6. Read last n lines
7. Append text to file
8. Copy file content to another file
9. Count lines in file
10. Count words in file
11. Count characters in file
12. Find longest word in file
13. Find shortest word in file
14. Search for word in file
15. Replace word in file

### Medium (16-30)

16. Count frequency of each word
17. Remove duplicate lines
18. Sort lines alphabetically
19. Reverse content of file
20. Merge two files
21. Split file into n parts
22. Find common words in two files
23. Create log file parser
24. Read CSV file
25. Write to CSV file
26. Read JSON file
27. Write to JSON file
28. Find file size
29. Check if file exists
30. Get file creation/modification time

### Hard (31-40)

31. Implement file compression
32. Implement file encryption
33. Create backup system
34. Find duplicate files
35. Search file in directory
36. Batch rename files
37. Organize files by extension
38. Create file indexer
39. Implement tail -f command
40. Parse large file efficiently

## Section 11: OOP (60 exercises)

### Easy (1-20)

8. Create setter method
9. Create class variable
10. Create instance variable
11. Create static method
12. Create class method
13. Create property decorator
14. Create setter decorator
15. Create deleter decorator
16. Inherit from parent class
17. Override parent method
18. Use super() function
19. Check instance type
20. Check class inheritance

### Medium (21-40)

21. Implement multiple inheritance
22. Implement multilevel inheritance
23. Implement hierarchical inheritance
24. Implement hybrid inheritance
25. Create abstract base class
26. Implement interface
27. Implement operator overloading (+)
28. Implement operator overloading (-)
29. Implement operator overloading (==)
30. Implement operator overloading (<)
31. Implement __len__ method
32. Implement __iter__ method
33. Implement __next__ method
34. Implement __call__ method
35. Implement __getitem__ method
36. Implement __setitem__ method
37. Implement __delitem__ method
38. Implement context manager
39. Implement descriptor
40. Implement weak reference

### Hard (41-60)

45. Implement decorator pattern

47. Implement facade pattern

52. Implement iterator pattern

54. Implement builder pattern
55. Implement prototype pattern
56. Implement flyweight pattern
57. Implement chain of responsibility
58. Implement mediator pattern

60. Implement visitor pattern

## Section 12: Error Handling (30 exercises)

### Easy (1-12)

1. Handle ZeroDivisionError

3. Handle TypeError
4. Handle IndexError
5. Handle KeyError
6. Handle FileNotFoundError
7. Handle multiple exceptions
8. Use else clause
9. Use finally clause
10. Raise exception manually
11. Create custom exception
12. Chain exceptions

### Medium (13-22)

13. Validate email with exception
14. Validate phone with exception
15. Validate age with exception
16. Create validation exception hierarchy
17. Handle file operation errors
18. Handle database errors
19. Handle API request errors
20. Handle JSON parsing errors
21. Handle network timeout
22. Retry on failure

### Hard (23-30)

23. Implement transaction rollback
24. Create error logging system
25. Implement circuit breaker
26. Create custom exception framework
27. Handle async errors
28. Implement error recovery
29. Create fault-tolerant system
30. Implement graceful degradation

## Section 13: Modules & Packages (30 exercises)

### Easy (1-12)

1. Create simple module
2. Import module
3. Import specific function
4. Import with alias
5. Import all from module
6. Create package with __init__.py
7. Import from package
8. Use relative import
9. Use absolute import
10. Create submodule
11. Use if __name__ == "__main__"
12. Create module documentation

### Medium (13-22)

13. Create utility module
14. Create math module
15. Create string module
16. Create file operations module
17. Create date/time module
18. Use built-in random module
19. Use built-in math module
20. Use built-in datetime module
21. Use built-in collections module
22. Use built-in itertools module

### Hard (23-30)

23. Create pip-installable package
24. Add package to PyPI
25. Create module with C extension
26. Use importlib for dynamic import
27. Create module loader
28. Implement plugin system
29. Create namespace package
30. Implement module versioning
